text:
I was born into a small, close-knit family. I had two parents and two older brothers, and we all lived together in a small town in northern Maine. Growing up, I was an extroverted, antagonistic, conscientious, emotionally stable, and open to experience child. 

My parents instilled the value of hard work and dedication in me from a young age. I remember my mom constantly reminding me to be diligent and finish my tasks before I had the chance to enjoy leisure activities. I was a good student and I worked hard to do well in school. I was also an active participant in extracurricular activities. I was involved in the school choir and drama club, and I also loved to play sports.

I was also quite creative and imaginative. I loved to come up with new ideas and create things with my hands. I remember my parents buying me arts and crafts supplies, and I would spend hours working on projects. I also enjoyed reading and writing, and I was always coming up with stories. I was an inquisitive child, and I was always asking questions and wanting to learn more about the world around me. 

I had a strong sense of self and I wasn't afraid to stand up for what I believed in. I was also quite loyal to my friends and family, and I always tried to do what was best for them. I was a kind and compassionate person, but I could also be quite opinionated and argumentative. I was always willing to stand up for what I believed in, and I wasn't afraid to voice my opinion. 

I was also an emotionally stable person, and I wasn't easily upset or overwhelmed. Even in difficult situations, I was able to stay calm and collected. I was also open to new experiences, and I was always willing to try new things. I had a strong sense of adventure and I enjoyed discovering new places and cultures. 

My childhood was filled with a lot of laughter and joy. I have many fond memories of my family and friends, and I am grateful for the experiences I had. I learned a lot about myself during this time, and I am thankful for the lessons that I have taken with me into adulthood.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
